abstract: Pope Francis gathers with other religious leaders at National September 11 Memorial and Museum to call for tolerance and unity on site of violence incited by religious extremism; public meeting with leaders of other religious faiths emphasizes church's commitment to forging bonds across religious boundaries.
lead_paragraph: Surrounded by hundreds of leaders from the world’s religions, Pope Francis on Friday called for them to be a “force for reconciliation,” in a place still haunted by violence committed in the name of extreme Islam.

headline.main: In a Void Created by Religious Violence, Pope Francis Shares Prayers for Peace
headline.print_headline: In a Void Created by Religious Violence, Leaders Share Prayers for Peace

snippet: Surrounded by hundreds of leaders from the world’s religions, Pope Francis on Friday called for them to be a “force for reconciliation,” in a place still haunted by violence committed in the name of extreme Islam.
